thread.title: Outrigger Hotels CEO stepping down, will take role on advisory board
thread.title_full: Outrigger Hotels CEO stepping down, will take role on advisory board

author: Janis L. Magin
title: Outrigger Hotels CEO stepping down, will take role on advisory board
text: David Carey, president and CEO, Outrigger Enterprises Group seen here accepting the… more Tina Yuen PBN David Carey is stepping down from his role as CEO of Outrigger Hotels and Resorts after leading the Hawaii-based hospitality company for more than 30 years and will be replaced by the CEO of California-based KSL Resorts, the company said late Wednesday. Carey will “transition into a lead role on the Outrigger advisory board” to focus on development, community relations and strategic growth, while Scott Dalecio , co-founder and CEO of KSL Resorts, which owns the Hotel del Coronado in San Diego and the Miraval resort in Arizona, will succeed him as interim CEO of Outrigger. David Carey, president and CEO, Outrigger Enterprises Group seen here accepting the… more Tina Yuen PBN Outrigger, which was founded by Roy and Estelle Kelley in Waikiki 70 years ago, was acquired last year by KSL Capital Partners based in Denver for an undisclosed amount. The company will remain headquartered in Waikiki. “Outrigger is poised to enter its next phase of reinvestment and growth because of the solid foundation built by David Carey and his team; we’re grateful that he will continue to contribute his knowledge and expertise as a member of our board,” Dalecio said in a statement. “From Waikiki to the Maldives, we are excited to invest in the future of Outrigger; by infusing additional support and resources at our properties, hosts will have the tools to perform at the highest level and further elevate the Outrigger guest experience.” Outrigger plans to invest some $100 million in improvements to its hotels and resorts over the next few years, and plans to add “both resources and expertise for business development and project management” as well as upgrades to technology and more focus on host training and support.
